title: Sql Injection in SecureApp Inc
description: Discovered SQL Injection via common input parameters affecting SecureApp Inc. The application does not properly sanitize user input, allowing an attacker to inject malicious payloads that are executed by the application.
impact: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary SQL queries, extract sensitive database contents, or modify data.
reproduction_steps: Observe that the payload is executed
proof_of_concept:
# Proof of Concept

Payload: ' OR '1'='1

This demonstrates SQL Injection via common input parameters
remediation: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements. Never concatenate user input into SQL queries. Implement input validation and use an ORM where possible.
